title: Incorrect diagnostic for unstable applicable items

labels.name: A-diagnostics
labels.description: Area: Messages for errors, warnings, and lints

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: A-suggestion-diagnostics
labels.description: Area: suggestions generated by the compiler applied by cargo fix

labels.name: D-incorrect
labels.description: A diagnostic that is giving misleading or incorrect information

body:
I tried to compile this code written for Rust 1.47+ with Rust 1.46:

```rust
fn foo(range: Range<usize>) -> bool {
    range.is_empty()
}
```

And I got this error (on 1.46):

```rust
error[E0034]: multiple applicable items in scope
   --> src/lib.rs:133:18
    |
133 |         if range.is_empty() {
    |            ------^^^^^^^^--
    |            |     |
    |            |     multiple `is_empty` found
    |            help: disambiguate the associated function for candidate #2: `std::iter::ExactSizeIterator::is_empty(&range)`
    |
    = note: candidate #1 is defined in an impl for the type `std::ops::Range<Idx>`
    = note: candidate #2 is defined in an impl of the trait `std::iter::ExactSizeIterator` for the type `std::ops::Range<usize>`
```

However, when I tried to use the inherent impl with `Range::is_empty(&range)`, it still failed to compile:

```rust
error[E0034]: multiple applicable items in scope
   --> src/lib.rs:133:19
    |
133 |         if Range::is_empty(range) {
    |            -------^^^^^^^^
    |            |      |
    |            |      multiple `is_empty` found
    |            help: disambiguate the associated function for candidate #2: `std::iter::ExactSizeIterator::is_empty`
    |
    = note: candidate #1 is defined in an impl for the type `std::ops::Range<Idx>`
note: candidate #2 is defined in the trait `std::iter::ExactSizeIterator`
```

As it turns out, `Range::is_empty()` was only stabilized in 1.47.0, so it is not actually available when compiling with stable 1.46.0. `ExactSizeIterator::is_empty()` is still unstable in 1.50.0, so it's also inaccessible here. Without that context, the error message is pretty confusing. I think we can do better here!

### Meta

`rustc --version --verbose`:
```
enrai instant-segment $ rustc -vV
rustc 1.46.0
binary: rustc
commit-hash: unknown
commit-date: unknown
host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu
release: 1.46.0
LLVM version: 10.0
```
